creator: juanmpd@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 27973
Zip containing: document describing details, and attached files

Configuring Apache with mod_jk and SSL support, requiring client certificate, and trying to access the server using client certificates issued by a known CA, triggers an “413 Request Entity Too Large” error. With other certificates there is no problem.
I'have attached a certificate issued by this CA (revoked, but this is no problem), so you can reproduce this error.
I have also attached a document with a more detailed explanation, and more files to configure an scenario where this error is shown.

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
Bugzilla is not a support forum.
Since mod_jk is developed as part of the Tomcat project, please post your question to the Tomcat users list:

http://tomcat.apache.org/lists.html

You might also want to look for "max_post_size" on

http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/generic_howto/proxy.html
http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/reference/workers.html

If you have further questions, please proceed on the Tomcat users list.

Regards,

Rainer

Ok. By the way the problem is solved commenting out the lines

#JkEnvVar SSL_CLIENT_CERT SSL_CLIENT_CERT
#JkOptions +ForwardSSLCertChain
creator: juanmpd@gmail.com
juanmpd@gmail.com
text: Really sorry. It wasn't a bug at all. As you noted, that should have been post in the Tomcat user list. In http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/generic_howto/proxy.html clearly states that when setting "JkOptions ForwardSSLCertChain" it is likely that you also need to adjust the maximal AJP packet size using the worker attribute max_packet_size.
